</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Board Committees
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Some of the Board&rsquo;s powers and duties are delegated to
	the Board committees. These are the Governance &amp; Nomination Committee, the Compensation Committee, the Audit Committee and&nbsp;the
	Corporate Responsibility Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The topical Board Committee charters are available on the Company&rsquo;s
	website, in the section &ldquo;Who we are/Corporate Governance&rdquo;.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	All Board Committees meet on a regular basis. Their members are
	provided with the materials necessary to fulfil their duties and responsibilities, and to&nbsp;submit full reports to the Board.
	The key accountabilities of the Board Committees at December 31, 2016, were the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Governance &amp; Nomination Committee (GNC)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Main Responsibilities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	oversees corporate governance issues at Company level
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	regularly reviews the independence of the Board and manages the Board&rsquo;s
	self-assessment process
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	reviews at least once per year the appropriateness and effectiveness
	of the Board committee structure and composition
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	supports the Board in the identification and selection of candidates
	for the Board and the CEO position
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">

	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	reviews at least once per year the succession plans for SEC members
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Governance &amp; Nomination Committee consists of the Chairman,
	who shall act as Chairman of the GNC, and up to three independent, non-executive members of the Board. The Group General Counsel
	or his/her delegate shall act&nbsp;as Secretary of the Governance &amp; Nomination Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Compensation Committee (CC)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Main Responsibilities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	reviews and recommends to the Board the compensation &amp; benefits
	principles, strategy and policies which define the compensation system
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	defines the elements and the structure of the compensation system,
	including the structure of share ownership plans
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	reviews and recommends to the Board on an annual basis a&nbsp;proposal
	for approval by the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders of the total compensation of the Board and the Executive Committee
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	pursuant to article 29 of the Articles of Incorporation, sets or amends
	the compensation packages of the members of the Executive Committee and prepares a proposal to the Board to&nbsp;set&nbsp;or amend
	the compensation package of the CEO
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	prepares and recommends to the Board the Compensation Report&nbsp;for
	approval.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Further information is available in the 2016 Syngenta Compensation
	Report and in the charter of the Compensation Committee on the Syngenta website in the section &ldquo;Who we are/Corporate Governance&rdquo;.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Compensation Committee consists of a minimum of three&nbsp;independent,
	non-executive members of the Board
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
	; the&nbsp;Chairman shall not be a member of the Compensation Committee. The Head
	of Human Resources or his/her delegate shall act as Secretary of&nbsp;the Compensation Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Audit Committee (AC)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Main Responsibilities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	assists the Board in fulfilling its supervisory responsibilities with&nbsp;respect
	to accounting and financial reporting practices of&nbsp;the&nbsp;Company
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	monitors the performance of the external auditor, checking its independence
	and coordinating its work with internal audit
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	monitors the implementation of findings of external and internal auditors
	by management
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	assesses the quality of the financial reporting and prepares Board&nbsp;decisions
	in this area
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	monitors the effectiveness of the financial compliance framework and
	of the internal controls environment.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

	89
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>

<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Audit Committee consists of at least three independent, non-executive
	members of the Board; the Chairman shall not be a&nbsp;member of the Audit Committee. A member of the Corporate Legal Department
	currently acts, as a delegate of the Group General Counsel, as Secretary of the Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Corporate Responsibility Committee (CRC)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Main Responsibilities
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	reviews and advises the Board on overall Corporate Responsibility priorities,
	policies and issues
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	acts as custodian of the Board in all Corporate Responsibility matters
	and exercises oversight over the Executive Committee in&nbsp;this respect
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	assesses the effectiveness of the implementation of Corporate Responsibility
	related internal policies.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Corporate Responsibility Committee consists of the Chairman,
	at least two further independent, non-executive members of the Board, and the CEO. The Group General Counsel or his/her delegate
	shall act as Secretary of the Corporate Responsibility Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	2
	meetings held in 2016; average length of the meetings: 2 hours
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Information and control instruments of the Board of&nbsp;Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Board recognizes the importance of being fully informed on&nbsp;material
	matters that impact Syngenta. It supervises management and monitors its performance through reporting and controlling processes
	and through the Board committees. It&nbsp;ensures that it has sufficient information to make the appropriate decisions through
	the following means:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	All members of the Executive Committee are regularly invited to attend
	Board meetings to report on their areas of responsibility, including key data for the core businesses, financial information, existing
	and potential risks, and updates on developments in important markets. Other members of management attend Board meetings as deemed
	necessary by the Board.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	At each Board meeting, the CEO reports on the meetings of the Executive
	Committee. The Chairman receives the minutes of the Executive Committee meetings; on request, the minutes are available to all
	members of the Board.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Board committees regularly meet as appropriate with members of management,
	external advisors and the external&nbsp;auditor.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Important information is regularly sent to the Board.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Risk management
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Risk management is of highest importance at Syngenta; responsibility
	for it is assumed by the Board and, within the scope of its duties, by every individual Board committee including the Audit Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	A Risk Management Policy sets out global standards for Syngenta
	and guidelines on how risks are to be identified, classified and managed throughout the business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 95 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	90
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage94"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The businesses and functions review their risks on a regular
	basis and decide on how these have developed and how they need to&nbsp;be classified and treated going forward. Specialized functions
	such as Group Finance, Health Safety &amp; Environment, Legal, Compliance and Security and many others support the business in
	managing risks in their respective areas. Group risks can be broadly categorized into financial, operational, legal, compliance,
	regulatory and strategic risks.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Group Risk Management at Syngenta collects information on all&nbsp;identified
	risks from businesses and functions on a regular basis and facilitates an assessment process by making its own assessment and challenging
	the teams as appropriate. Risks are&nbsp;described and tracked on a dedicated Risk Management Information System.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Group Risk Management reports Syngenta&rsquo;s Risk Profile to&nbsp;the
	Syngenta Executive Committee and the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Audit
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Internal Audit
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Internal Audit, as an independent function, carries out control,
	operational and system audits. All subsidiaries are within the scope of Internal Audit. Audit plans are reviewed and approved by&nbsp;the
	Audit Committee, and any suspected irregularities noted during audits are reported without delay. Internal Audit reports on&nbsp;issues
	arising from internal audits to the Audit Committee and&nbsp;shares reports with the external auditor.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	External auditor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The external auditor is accountable to the Audit Committee, the
	Board and ultimately to the shareholders. At the completion of the&nbsp;audit, the external auditor presents and discusses the
	audit reports on the financial statements and internal controls with the Audit Committee, highlighting the significant accounting,
	control and auditing matters addressed during the course of the audit. The&nbsp;external auditor attends all Audit Committee meetings
	and at&nbsp;least once a year the external auditor takes part in a meeting with the Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Duration of the mandate and term of office of the lead&nbsp;auditor
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	KPMG AG was initially elected as external auditor at the Annual
	General Meeting in April 2014. The appointment is for one year and can be renewed annually. The auditor in charge may serve for
	no more than five years. The current auditor in charge, Richard Broadbelt, has served for three business years (2014&ndash;2016).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Board of Directors oversight over external audit
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Audit Committee, on behalf of the Board, is responsible for
	monitoring the performance of the external auditor and verifying its&nbsp;independence. In addition, the Audit Committee monitors
	the&nbsp;implementation of findings of the external auditor by the management. The Audit Committee also considers and makes recommendations
	on the appointment, reappointment or removal of the external auditor to the Board, which then nominates the external auditor for
	election by the Annual General Meeting. As&nbsp;an&nbsp;additional duty, the Audit Committee authorizes non-audit services of the
	external auditor permitted under any of the listing or other rules applicable to Syngenta. The CFO and the Group Financial Controller
	are generally invited to the meetings of the Audit Committee; the external auditor, the Head Internal Audit and&nbsp;other members
	of management may also be invited as appropriate. The&nbsp;Chairman of the Audit Committee reports orally to the Board after each
	meeting on the work performed by&nbsp;the Committee, its findings and actions undertaken.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Executive Committee and Executive Team
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Under the leadership of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO), the
	Executive Committee is responsible for the active leadership and the operative management of the Company. It consists of the CEO,
	the President Global Crop Protection and EAME, LATAM and APAC, the President Global Seeds and North America, the Chief Financial
	Officer (CFO), the Head Research &amp; Development, the Head Global Operations and the Head Legal &amp; Taxes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 96 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	91
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Executive Committee, together with the Head Human Resources,
	the Head Corporate Affairs and the Head Business Development, builds the Executive Team.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	J. Erik Fyrwald has been CEO of the Company since June 1, 2016,
	succeeding John Ramsay who was CEO
<I>
	ad interim
</I>
	from November 1, 2015, to May 31, 2016, apart from his function as CFO. As
	per September 30, 2016, John Ramsay also stepped down as CFO of the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	During the reporting year, three further members of the Syngenta
	Executive Committee stepped down from their functions: Caroline Luscombe, Head Human Resources (at June 30, 2016), Jonathan Seabrook,
	Head Corporate Affairs (at September 30, 2016) and Davor Pisk, COO APAC &amp; North America (at October 31, 2016).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;

	At January 31, 2017

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	*
	Members of the Executive Committee
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Responsibilities of the Executive Committee&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The duties of the Executive Committee comprise in particular:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	formulation of the fundamentals of corporate policy
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	designing the Company&rsquo;s strategy and strategic plans for the&nbsp;approval of the Board of Directors (the Board)
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	implementation of the strategies, strategic plans and the periodic&nbsp;assessment of the attainment of goals
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	submission of regular reports for the attention of the Board or&nbsp;its&nbsp;Committees
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	promotion of a modern and active leadership culture
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	establishment of an active communications policy within and outside the Company
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">

	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	systematic selection, development and promotion of new and potential management personnel
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	examination and approval of significant agreements with third parties and business activities involving extraordinary high
	risks
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD>
	establishment of guidelines for planning, organization, finance, reporting, information and other technology,&nbsp;etc.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Chief Executive Officer (CEO)&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The CEO is nominated by the Board; he shares responsibility for&nbsp;the
	strategic direction of the Company with the Chairman. The&nbsp;CEO and the Executive Committee are jointly responsible for&nbsp;the
	active leadership and operative management of the Company. The CEO leads the Executive Committee. Members of&nbsp;the Executive
	Committee are directly responsible to the CEO. The&nbsp;CEO, together with the Chairman, manages the reputation of&nbsp;the Company
	and represents the interests of the Company to&nbsp;important stakeholders and the general public.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 97 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
<B>
	Duration of employment contracts
	and mandates
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Employment contracts with members
	of the Executive Committee are concluded for an indefinite term. The maximum notice period for the CEO and all members of the
	Executive Committee is 12&nbsp;months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	The members of the Executive Committee,
	subject to the approval by&nbsp;the Chairman of the Board, may hold no more than&nbsp;the following number of mandates in the
	supreme executive bodies of&nbsp;companies and organizations:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; COLOR: BLACK">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	up
	to 2 mandates in listed companies
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; COLOR: BLACK">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	up
	to 2 mandates in non-listed companies
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; COLOR: BLACK">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	up
	to 4 mandates upon instruction of Syngenta in companies that are not directly or indirectly
	controlled by Syngenta
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL; COLOR: BLACK">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	up
	to 10 mandates in (i) charitable organizations, (ii) associations or foundations and
	(iii) other non-profit institutions.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Several mandates held in different
	companies of the same group count as one mandate. Mandates within companies under the direct or indirect control of Syngenta (subsidiaries)
	or which are not&nbsp;required to be registered in the Swiss Commercial Register or&nbsp;a&nbsp;similar foreign register are not
	limited by numbers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Chief Executive Officer&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Member of the Corporate Responsibility
	Committee
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
<B>
	Professional background
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; COLOR: #424242">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	J. Erik Fyrwald was
	previously President and Chief Executive Officer of Univar, a leading distributor of chemistry and related products and services
	(2012&ndash;2016); President of Ecolab, a cleaning and sanitation, water treatment, and oil and gas products and services provider
	(2011&ndash;2012); and Chairman, President and Chief Executive Officer of Nalco, a water treatment and oil and gas products and
	services company (2008&ndash;2011). He was Group Vice President of the Agriculture and Nutrition Division of the E. I. du Pont
	de Nemours and Company &ndash; DuPont (2003&ndash;2008). Apart from his functions in Syngenta, J. Erik Fyrwald serves on the Board
	of Directors for Eli Lilly and Company (including their Science and Technology Committee), CropLife International and the Swiss-American
	Chamber of Commerce.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; COLOR: #424242">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; COLOR: #424242">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	He holds a Bachelor&rsquo;s
	degree in Chemical Engineering from the University of Delaware and completed the Advanced Management Program at Harvard Business
	School.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; COLOR: #424242">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</B>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">

</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
<B>
	Professional background
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Christoph M&auml;der was Head of
	Legal &amp; Public Affairs for Novartis Crop Protection (1999&ndash;2000) and Senior Corporate Counsel for Novartis International
	AG (1992&ndash;1998). He is Vice Chairman of economiesuisse, the main umbrella organization representing Swiss economy. He is
	also a non-executive Director of Lonza AG (listed company), a member of the Board of scienceindustries, the association of Swiss
	chemical, pharmaceutical and biotech industries, and a member of the Board of the Basel Chamber of Commerce.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	He graduated from Basel University
	Law School, and is admitted to the Bar in Switzerland.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
<B>
	Professional background
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Prior to her current function as
	Head Research &amp; Development, Patricia Malarkey was Head Research &amp; Development for Lawn &amp; Garden at Syngenta (2012&minus;2013).
	Before that, she held a number of senior scientific functions in Crop Protection, Seeds and Biotechnology at Syngenta in Europe
	and the United States. Patricia Malarkey holds no other mandates in the supreme executive bodies of listed or non-listed companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	She graduated from the University
	of Glasgow in Agricultural Chemistry and holds a master&rsquo;s degree in Toxicology from the University of Surrey.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Prior to his current function as
	President Global Crop Protection and EAME, LATAM and APAC, Jonathan Parr was Chief Operating Officer (COO) EAME &amp; Latin America
	(2015&ndash;2016). Before that, he was Head of Global Crops &amp; Assets for Syngenta (2014), Regional Director for EAME (2009&ndash;2013),
	Head of Syngenta Flowers (2007&ndash;2008), Head of Marketing and Strategy (2004&ndash;2007) and European Manufacturing Manager
	(2000&ndash;2003). Before joining Syngenta, he worked for AstraZeneca as a Factory Manager (1998&ndash;2000), Global Product Manager
	Fungicides (1996&ndash;1998) and Supply Chain Project Manager (1994&ndash;1996). From 1987 to 1994, he held Project and Engineering
	Management functions at Imperial Chemical Industries (ICI). Jonathan Parr holds no other mandates in the supreme executive bodies
	of listed or non-listed companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLACK">
	Jonathan Parr is a Chartered Engineer
	and also holds an honors Bachelor degree in Civil Engineering from the University of Southampton as well as a Master in Management
	from the University of McGill, Canada, and a diploma in International Management from the INSEAD Institute.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Management contracts
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta has not entered into management contracts with any third
	party.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Service contracts / Change of control
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The employment agreements of members of the Executive
	Committee, including the CEO, and the agreements of the members of the Board of Directors, including the Chairman, do not
	have any change of control clauses. Neither the Executive Committee nor the Board of Directors agreements contain any
	provisions for termination payments (&ldquo;golden parachute&rdquo; or &ldquo;handshake&rdquo; or similar arrangements) with
	regard to severance or other termination events.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Relationships and arrangements involving Directors or members
	of the Executive Committee
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	None of the above Directors or members of the Executive Committee
	has any family relationship with any other Director or member of the Executive Committee. There were no arrangements or understandings
	with major shareholders, customers, suppliers or others, pursuant to which any of the above Directors or of the Executive Committee
	members was selected as a Director or as member of the Executive Committee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Employees of Syngenta
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	2016
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta had approximately 27,600 permanent employees as of December
	31, 2016.&nbsp;Approximately 15 percent of these were in North America, 18 percent in Latin America, 22 percent in Asia Pacific
	and the remaining 45 percent in Europe, Africa and Middle East.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	ended December 31, 2016 was approximately as follows:

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The number of temporary employees varies greatly during each
	year due to the seasonal nature of the business. During 2016, the highest level of temporary employees was approximately 3,200.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In several countries, part of the workforce is unionized or represented
	by works councils. Syngenta&rsquo;s relationships with its unions and other employee organizations are generally good and there
	have been no significant industrial disputes over the past five years at any of Syngenta&rsquo;s major business locations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	2015
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta had approximately 28,400 permanent employees as of December
	31, 2015.&nbsp;Approximately 15 percent of these were in North America, 18 percent in Latin America, 22 percent in Asia Pacific
	and the remaining 45 percent in Europe, Africa and Middle East.
</P>

	&nbsp;

	4,700.

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	2014
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta had approximately 29,000 permanent employees as of December
	31, 2014.&nbsp;Approximately 16 percent of these were in North America, 17 percent in Latin America, 22 percent in Asia Pacific
	and the remaining 45 percent in Europe, Africa and Middle East.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The functional distribution of Syngenta employees for the year
	ended December 31, 2014 was approximately as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Share ownership
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The aggregate amount of Syngenta shares and share options held
	by current Directors and the members of the Executive Committee as of December 31, 2016, based on information available to the
	Company, is 0.12 percent of all outstanding shares, i.e. none of Syngenta&rsquo;s Directors or the Executive Committee members
	individually owns more than one percent of the Company&rsquo;s outstanding shares. For more information on Syngenta shares and
	share options owned by individual Directors and by individual members of the Executive Committee see &ldquo;Compensation Report,
	2016 Holding of shares and options&rdquo;.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	For a description of arrangements involving Syngenta&rsquo;s
	employees in the capital of the Company, see Note 23, &ldquo;Employee share participation plans&rdquo;, to the consolidated financial
	statements in Item&nbsp;18.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Compensation elements
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta&rsquo;s total compensation package includes:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	fixed
	compensation &ndash; base salary
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	variable
	compensation &ndash; short-term incentive plans and, for selected leaders, long-term incentive plans
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	benefits
	(including all insured benefits and retirement pension plans).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Fixed compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Fixed compensation is represented as annual base salary paid
	in cash, typically on a monthly basis and set by reference to the:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	size and scope of the job
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	external market value of the job
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	skills, experience and performance of the employee.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	To ensure market competitiveness, base salaries are subject to
	review every year by considering factors such as Company affordability, benchmark data, external market movement, economic environment
	and individual performance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In addition, certain employees may receive customary cash allowances
	for expenses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Variable compensation
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Variable compensation consists of short-term incentives and,
	for selected leaders, long-term incentives. Target variable compensation is determined by the work level and scope of the individual&rsquo;s
	job, as well as the external market value of the respective job and the location. The actual payment is dependent on business performance
	and individual performance. It may be granted in cash, shares, restricted stock units, performance stock units and/or stock options.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	All of the variable compensation plans are governed by their
	own set of regulations which include leaver provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The various short- and long-term incentive plans are summarized
	in the table below with more detail in the following sections.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Short-Term Incentive (STI)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The target STI is set as a percentage of base salary which varies
	by work level as shown in the table&nbsp;below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 68%; BORDER: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	STI targets (as a percentage of base salary)
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">

	Chief Executive Officer

	80%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

	70%
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	30%&ndash;40%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	Management
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	25%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Higher
	target percentages apply to managers and senior managers in the USA
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Both the individual and financial percentage awards can range
	from zero to 200 percent of the STI target as outlined in the Articles of Incorporation (Article 29, 10). The STI payout is limited
	to two times the target award.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	STI design for Executive Committee members
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	For Executive Committee members, emphasis is placed on the achievement
	of financial results. Financial performance measures determine 70 percent of the STI award, while 30 percent is based on individual
	performance. The financial performance measure consists of earnings per share (EPS) (55 percent) and cash flow return on investment
	(CFROI) of the Group (15 percent). Individual performance is measured against goals set within the performance management process.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	In addition, the STI payout is contingent upon the annual Group
	Net Income (GNI) reaching a threshold of 85 percent of the target budget.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	STI design for managers and employees below the Executive
	Committee
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	For managers and employees below the Executive Committee, the
	STI award weights equally Company financial results and individual performance. Financial performance is determined primarily on
	the basis of full year business contribution versus budget and further key performance indicators including market share, progressive
	improvement in business quality, price increases, foreign exchange mitigation and inventory management.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Individual performance is measured in the same way as for Executive
	Committee members.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<I>
	STI payout determination
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At the end of the calendar year both Company and individual performance
	are assessed, and actual achievement is compared with the targets and goals set at the beginning of the year. The assessment of
	financial performance is formula-driven, i.e. actual achievement against target determines the STI percentage award. The assessment
	of individual performance results in a performance rating which is used to determine an individual percentage award for STI purposes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Deferred Share Plan (DSP)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The DSP is used to convert part of the annual cash-based STI
	into a three-year equity based plan and is offered to around 350 participants globally.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	It requires a mandatory percentage of the STI to be deferred
	into Syngenta share awards with a vesting period of three years thereby exposing participants fully to the share value development
	over this period. A participant may voluntarily defer a further portion of the STI into share awards. In return, Syngenta matches
	each deferred share award on a one-for-one basis, thus doubling the total number of shares received by the participant. The matching
	of the share awards is subject to continued employment with Syngenta at the end of the three-year vesting period. The mandatory
	and voluntary percentages vary by work level as shown in the table below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 65%; BORDER: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	STI subject to deferral
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 12%; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mandatory
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 12%; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Voluntary
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Maximum
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

	40%
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The number of share awards is calculated based on the closing
	share price at grant date and the amount of STI deferred (mandatory plus any voluntary amount). The calculation is made by applying
	the following formula:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2017/02/16/0000950103-17-001494_IMAGE_002.JPG" ALT="HTTP:||WWW.SEC.GOV|ARCHIVES|EDGAR|DATA|1123661|000095010316011050|I6B.JPG" STYLE="HEIGHT: 115PX; WIDTH: 624PX">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_43"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	Long-Term Incentive (LTI) Plans
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The target LTI is set as a percentage of base salary which varies
	by work level as shown in the table below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 67%; BORDER: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; BORDER-TOP: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	LTI target (as a percentage of base salary)
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Chief Executive Officer
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	140%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Executive Committee
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	100%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

	Senior Management
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	25%&ndash;40%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID; BORDER-LEFT: BLACK 1PT SOLID; PADDING: 2PT">
