<A NAME="eolPage211"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Assessment of the impact of market risks
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The impact of market risks is assessed using
	a variety of Value-at-Risk (VaR) and Earnings-at-Risk (EaR) methods. These methods are adjusted to reflect the nature of the exposures
	and the impact of the exposures on profit or loss of the financial year. The specific methods used to assess the impact of financial
	risks are described&nbsp;below:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_INCOME_STATEMENT_3"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Risk
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 7%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Method
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 41%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Exposure (financial statement item)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 16%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Time horizon (months)
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Foreign exchange risk
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	Trading transaction &ndash; committed
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	VaR
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Monetary asset and liability carrying amounts
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	1
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	Trading transaction &ndash; uncommitted
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	EaR
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Operating income
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	12
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	Issued financial debt and interest
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	VaR
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Monetary liability carrying amounts
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	1
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 0.25IN">
	Translation
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	VaR
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Cumulative translation adjustment in OCI
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	1
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Interest rate risk
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	EaR
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Interest expense
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	12
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Commodity price risk
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	EaR
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Operating income
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	12
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_INCOME_STATEMENT>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	VaR and EaR calculations are risk management
	tools designed to statistically estimate with a pre-set probability the maximum amount of&nbsp;potential losses in value (VaR)
	or earnings (EaR) over a specific (holding) time period given current and forecast positions and possible movements in market prices.
	The VaR and EaR methods used by Syngenta estimate the gross impact on the consolidated financial statements if&nbsp;the underlying
	items were not hedged and the net impact of the combined underlying hedged items and the related hedging instruments. VaR and EaR
	calculations attempt to recognize that holding different assets and liabilities or incurring different future cash flow exposures
	may reduce portfolio risk through diversification. Such diversification effects are captured within the calculations, which aim
	to present the risk based on Syngenta&rsquo;s currency exposure as a whole, rather than the sum of the exposures to the individual
	currency pairs within the portfolio of exposures. Using historical data, the VaR and EaR calculations are designed to predict possible
	changes in the markets in the future at a 99 percent confidence level, with a 1 percent probability that actual results will be
	worse than calculated. The time horizon used to calculate the VaR figures for each risk is determined by the time period over which
	management forecasts and monitors changes in the risk and in Syngenta&rsquo;s exposure to it and takes mitigating actions in response
	to those changes.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The assessment of the impact of market risks
	is performed monthly and the results are compared against annually defined risk limits. In&nbsp;cases where the net impact is higher
	than a risk limit, Syngenta enters into derivative financial instrument transactions in order to stay within&nbsp;the risk limits
	approved in the risk management policy. Breaches of risk limits, should they occur, are immediately reported to senior management.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta cannot predict future movements in risk
	variables precisely, therefore calculations of the impact of market risks neither represent actual losses nor consider the effects
	of potential favorable movements in underlying risk variables. Accordingly, these calculations may only be an indication of future
	movements to the extent the historic market patterns repeat in the future.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Foreign exchange risk&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Operating worldwide exposes Syngenta to foreign
	exchange transaction and translation risk at both the Group and subsidiary level. Syngenta&rsquo;s policy is to hedge the effect
	of foreign exchange&nbsp;translation risk on shareholders&rsquo; equity only in specific circumstances, for example to protect
	the value of temporary excess&nbsp;foreign currency denominated cash positions.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Foreign exchange transaction risk &ndash; committed&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta&rsquo;s individual subsidiaries predominantly
	transact their operational activities in their respective functional currencies. However,&nbsp;the globally integrated nature of
	Syngenta&rsquo;s business results in its subsidiaries bearing some amount of transactional balance sheet risk, because some monetary
	items (including financial&nbsp;liabilities) are denominated in foreign currencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Such committed foreign currency exposures are
	largely generated by the routing of products from Syngenta&rsquo;s central manufacturing sites to its foreign locations. The risk
	management strategy is to ensure that these committed exposures are fully hedged, unless otherwise approved by Group Treasury,
	for example where not deemed cost-effective or where there is no forward market for a specific currency.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The derivative instruments that Syngenta&rsquo;s
	risk management policy allows to be used to manage the risk are foreign exchange forward contracts and cross currency swaps with
	the same risk (foreign exchange currency index), where the fair value movements of the hedges and the retranslation of the underlying
	committed exposures are largely offset in profit or loss.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The derivative instruments are placed with the
	same maturity as the expected cash flows of the hedged transactions so that the timing of the cash flows of the items within the
	hedged exposure effectively matches the timing of the cash flows of the derivative instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 50 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	50
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage212"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Net committed transactional currency exposures
	are identified and reported on a monthly basis by business units. The impact of the hedging program can be illustrated in the VaR
	calculations for committed exposures, which relate to the revaluation of exposures relative to spot rates over a monthly period.
	The impact of interest differentials and other factors is not included in these calculations.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

</TD>

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">

	8

</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At December 31, 2016, the Value-at-Risk for a
	one month holding period, after hedges, at a 99 percent confidence level was $8&nbsp;million (December 31, 2015: $20 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: RGB(64,64,64); FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The largest exposure
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: RGB(64,64,64)">
	s
	arise in Brazilian real, Swiss franc, British p
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: #282828">
	o
</FONT>
	und sterling and Russian ruble. Switzerland
	and Great Britain house large research and manufacturing sites. In recent years, due to the growth of Syngenta sales, exposures
	in emerging markets (particularly Brazil) have become significant.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Foreign exchange transaction risk &ndash; uncommitted
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Uncommitted transactions are expected, highly
	probable future transactions for which Syngenta does&nbsp;not yet have a contractual right or obligation (mainly sales and costs).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The US dollar represents the biggest single currency
	for both sales and costs. However, currency mismatches arise from Syngenta having a&nbsp;centralized cost base, denominated mainly
	in Swiss francs, British pounds and US dollars, against a local selling base, denominated mainly in US dollars, Euros and various
	other currencies, including those in emerging markets. In addition, due to the seasonality of Syngenta&rsquo;s business, the majority
	of sales occur during the first half of the year whereas costs tend to occur more linearly throughout the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: RGB(64,64,64); FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The risk management objective is to&nbsp;minimize
	the impact of changes in foreign exchange rates on the operating income forecasted to result from these transactions. Syngenta
	considers hedging this exposure unless it can reliably expect that operating income could, without significant adverse economic
	impact, be protected by adjusting the pricing of forecast transactions for changes in foreign exchange rates before those transactions
	occur. Hedging transactions are managed to minimize the potential adverse movement for the entire portfolio of the net transactional
	flows, rather than on an individual currency basis. Transactions in a specific calendar year are managed cumulatively in separate
	portfolios.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The cumulative diversified risk of the whole
	portfolio can be reduced by entering into derivative transactions for a portion or the full amount of the individual transactions
	so that the remaining risk of the whole portfolio is at acceptable levels within clearly defined risk limits. The risk management
	objective is applicable for transactions in the following 24 months. Currently transactions for the next 12 month period are being
	hedged.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The derivative instruments that Syngenta&rsquo;s
	risk management policy allows to be used to manage the risk are:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	foreign exchange forward contracts and net purchased
	currency options with the same risk (foreign exchange currency index) which are eliminating or reducing the uncertainty in the
	cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	placed mainly with the same or (to a lesser extent) with
	shorter maturity than the timing of the cash flows being hedged so that the timing of the cash flows of the hedged transactions
	effectively matches the timing of the cash flows of the derivative instrument.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The impact of the hedging program on operating
	income can be illustrated in the Earnings-at-Risk calculation performed for anticipated net transactional currency flows for the
	following year taking into account related currency hedges.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

	Argentine peso
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At December 31, 2016, the total potential adverse
	movement for 2017 net transactional flows after hedges relative to year-end, at a 99 percent confidence level, was $128 million
	(December 31, 2015: $528 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The net resulting Earnings-at-Risk figures at
	December 31, 2016 decreased by $400 million compared with December 31, 2015 mainly due to the large reduction in the risk of the
	Argentine peso (December 31, 2015: $500 million vs. December 31, 2016: $27 million). This reduction is a product of the Argentine
	peso stabilizing through the year after the sharp devaluation in December 2015 which occurred due to the election of the new government
	in Argentina.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 51 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	51
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage213"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: #1F497D">
	T
</FONT>
	he risk
	is similar to the levels seen at the end of 2014 with the greatest exposures being the Swiss franc, where Syngenta&nbsp;has a significant
	cost base in Switzerland with no material offsetting sales, and the Brazilian real, where a significant cost base is only partially
	offset by sales because sales in Brazil are largely dollarized.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Foreign exchange transaction risk &ndash; issued
	financial debt and&nbsp;interest
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta has a funding strategy which involves
	securing a diversification of funding sources in different markets and maintaining an optimal currency mix of debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	This additional foreign currency exposure arises
	from the debt issuances in Euro and in Swiss franc under the Euro Medium Term Note (EMTN) program. The risk management objective
	is to&nbsp;minimize the impact of changes in foreign exchange rates on these foreign currency denominated debt interest and principal
	repayments.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The foreign exchange risk on the foreign currency
	denominated debt is managed mostly by derivative instruments, and to a lesser extent within a portfolio of other committed transactions,
	so that no material foreign currency risk remains as a result of the foreign currency denominated debt.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The derivative instruments which Syngenta&rsquo;s
	risk management policy allows to be used to manage the risk are:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	cross currency swaps designated as hedges of foreign
	exchange risk of future interest and principal payments on foreign currency financial debt which are eliminating or reducing the
	uncertainty in the cash flows.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	placed mainly with the same terms as the items being
	hedged so that the timing of the interest and principal repayments of the hedged transactions effectively matches the timing of
	the cash flows of the derivative instrument.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Foreign exchange translation risk
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Translation exposure arises from the consolidation
	of foreign currency denominated financial statements of Syngenta&rsquo;s subsidiaries. This&nbsp;is&nbsp;reported as currency translation
	effects in OCI.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Translation risk can be significant; however,
	Syngenta regards its equity base to be of sufficient magnitude generally to absorb the short- to medium-term impact of exchange
	rate movements.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta can use both foreign currency denominated
	debt and net investment hedging to manage this exposure. The latter incorporates specific actions to protect the value of temporary
	excess foreign currency denominated cash positions. No hedging was undertaken for exposures of this type during the years ended
	December 31, 2016 or 2015. The exposure is deemed to be mitigated by the large net asset base of Syngenta and consequently no additional
	management of the exposure was undertaken in 2016 or 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The table below presents the 1-month translation
	Value-at-Risk:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_138"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

</TD>

	335
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	419
</TD>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At December 31, 2016, the Value-at-Risk for a
	one month holding period at a 99 percent confidence level was $335 million (December 31, 2015: $419 million). The Value-at-Risk
	at December 31, 2016 is lower than as of December 31, 2015 mainly driven by an increased Swiss franc volatility in 2015 due to
	the removal by the Swiss Central Bank of the cap of the Swiss franc against the Euro.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The two largest single currency exposures arise
	in the Brazilian real and Swiss franc, driven by the large operations and investments in facilities in Switzerland and Brazil.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Interest rate risk&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta is exposed to fluctuations in interest
	rates on its borrowings (including forecasted borrowings) and excess cash. While the majority of Syngenta&rsquo;s borrowings have
	fixed interest rates, portions of Syngenta&rsquo;s net borrowings, including its short-term commercial paper program and local
	borrowings, are subject to changes in short-term interest rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta monitors its interest rate exposures
	and analyzes the potential impact of interest rate movements on net interest expense. The risk management strategy involves ensuring
	an efficient fixed/floating mix of total debt within approved interest rate limits.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The derivative instruments allowed to manage
	the risk are interest rate swaps relating to future interest payments of financial debt liabilities. The derivative instruments
	are placed with the same maturity as the expected cash flows of the hedged transactions so that the timing of the cash flows of
	the hedged transactions effectively matches the timing of the cash flows of the derivative instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At December 31, 2016, the net amount of Earnings-at-Risk
	on floating rate debt due to potential changes in&nbsp;interest rates (a parallel shift of 100 bps was applied) was $
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	10
</FONT>
	million (2015: $10 million). The&nbsp;net amount of Earnings-at-Risk on net debt, as defined under &ldquo;Capital structure&rdquo;
	below, due to&nbsp;potential&nbsp;changes in interest rates was immaterial at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2016 and 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Commodity price risks&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Operating in the agribusiness sector, changes
	in certain commodity prices affect Syngenta&rsquo;s reported operating results and cash flows. On a limited basis, Syngenta enters
	into derivative transactions to hedge the exposure of its cost base to commodity prices. This&nbsp;activity comprises oil and
	natural gas hedging in the UK and USA, as well as soft commodity hedging for corn and soybean purchases by the Seeds business
	in the USA, Canada, Brazil and Argentina, where Syngenta contracts to purchase various seed crops from growers and hedges the
	cost of the purchases. In&nbsp;barter arrangements where Syngenta sells products in exchange for receiving a certain amount of
	a commodity crop, Syngenta hedges the value of the crop. At December 31, 2016 and 2015, there were no open hedging transactions
	for Brazil and Argentina corn and soybean price risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 52 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	52
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage214"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta has indirect exposure to oil price
	fluctuations mainly through the impact of oil prices on the cost of both raw materials, especially chemical intermediates in the
	Crop Protection business, and distribution activities. At December 31, 2016, there was no hedge protection in place for oil for
	2017 (December 31, 2015: no hedge protection in place for oil for 2016). As the exposure to oil is indirect, Syngenta does not
	calculate the Earnings-at-Risk due to potential changes in oil&nbsp;prices.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Natural gas exposure occurs in Syngenta&rsquo;s
	primary manufacturing sites and Syngenta is managing the exposure by hedging the main risk component, which is the natural gas
	market price, contractually linked to the NYMEX natural gas benchmark price. The other risk components within the exposure are
	immaterial.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The main objective of managing commodity price
	risk is to reduce the&nbsp;impact of commodity price changes on operating income and to provide economic protection against future
	cost increases. Syngenta uses fixed price contracts and derivatives (both Over-the-Counter (OTC) and exchange traded instruments,
	including commodity option and futures contracts) to achieve this objective. The derivative instruments are placed with the same
	maturity as the expected cash flows of the hedged transactions so that the timing of the cash flows of the hedged transactions
	effectively matches the timing of the cash flows of the derivative instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At December 31, 2016, the net amount of Earnings-at-Risk
	due to potential changes in natural gas prices was not material. Earnings-at-Risk due to potential changes in prices of soft commodities,
	principally corn and soybean, assuming a 12-month holding period are presented below.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

	($m, except risk reduction %)
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	December 31, 2016
<BR>
	Earnings-at-Risk
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	December 31, 2015
<BR>
	Earnings-at-Risk
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 34%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Soft commodities
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	Gross impact
</TD>

</TD>

</TD>

	Net impact
</TD>

	Risk reduction
</TD>

	1

</TD>

	36
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	28
</TD>

	23%
</TD>

	40
</TD>

</TD>

	60%
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	As
	the main soft commodities are largely correlated to each other, the impact of diversification
	is immaterial
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The Earnings-at-Risk of soft commodities is driven
	by their high price volatility compared to other asset classes. The hedging program reduces overall 12-month Earnings-at-Risk at
	December 31, 2016 to&nbsp;$28 million (December 31, 2015: $16 million). The increase in net&nbsp;risk in 2016 is mainly due to
	lower hedge ratios.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Derivatives and hedge accounting
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta seeks to apply, wherever possible, hedge
	accounting to&nbsp;present its financial statements in accordance with the economic purpose of the hedging activity. Hedges for
	which hedge accounting is not adopted either (a) do not meet the requirements for hedge accounting treatment under IFRS or (b)
	when combined with the accounting for the underlying hedged items, impact the financial statements in a manner aligned with the
	economic purpose of the hedging transaction without the need to&nbsp;adopt hedge accounting treatment, for example hedges of monetary
	items denominated in foreign currency.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta determines the economic
	relationship between the hedged items and the hedging instruments by reviewing the critical terms of the hedged items and the
	hedging instruments. As a result Syngenta concludes that the risk being hedged for the hedged items and risk inherent in the
	hedging instruments are sufficiently aligned, there is no inherent mismatch in the hedging relationship and a 100 percent
	hedge ratio applies both for the actual quantities hedged and for the hedge accounting, except as described below.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	For the hedging of foreign currency risk of uncommitted
	forecasted trading transactions, because the exposures are largely generated by the routing of products from Syngenta&rsquo;s central
	manufacturing sites to its foreign locations, the profit or&nbsp;loss impact from the corresponding transactions occurs when the
	related finished product inventories are sold to third parties. When entering into derivative hedging contracts, Syngenta selects
	maturity dates based on the forecast period that Syngenta holds inventories of its products for each commercial market by hedged
	currency exposure. Limited variability in the holding period occurs mainly due to timing of the third party sales transactions
	(&ldquo;inventory holding period mismatch&rdquo;).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	For the hedging of commodity price risk of
	soy and corn, there is variability between the index being hedged (CBOT) and the drivers of the actual exposures (local soy
	elevator prices based on CBOT and Syngenta seeds production and selling prices based on CBOT). The variability is, however,
	limited to individual transactions within the group of transactions in this hedging program &ndash; and a hedge ratio of 100
	percent is observed for the whole group of transactions.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The following table summarizes the accounting
	treatment, sources of ineffectiveness and the effectiveness assessment method for the identified financial market risks:
</P>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Ineffectiveness is recognized in
	the consolidated income statement in Other general and administrative for hedges of uncommitted foreign currency
	forecast transactions, in Financial expense, net for hedges of committed foreign currency monetary items, in Financial
	expense, net for hedges of interest rate risk and in Cost of goods sold for hedges of commodity price risk. For the years
	ended December 31, 2016 and 2015 none of the above potential sources of ineffectiveness, individually or collectively,
	resulted in material amounts of actual ineffectiveness being reported for any hedge accounting relationships.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	the period for hedge effectiveness purposes was $7 million (2015:&nbsp;$4&nbsp;million).

	corresponding tables in prior years&rsquo; financial statements, which included the related income tax effects.

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(22)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(69)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	(71)
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
	(93)
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Amounts reclassified from the cash flow hedge
	reserve into profit or loss are recognized in the consolidated income statement in Other general and administrative for hedges
	of uncommitted foreign currency forecast transactions, in Financial expense, net for hedges of committed foreign currency monetary
	items and for hedges of interest rate risk and in Cost of goods sold for hedges of commodity price risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Credit risk&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Credit risk arises from the possibility that
	counterparties involved in transactions with Syngenta may default on their obligation, resulting in financial losses to Syngenta.
	Credit risk relates both to financial assets (including derivatives, marketable securities and money market contracts) as well
	as to operational assets managed by Syngenta&rsquo;s businesses (such as trade receivables).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta&rsquo;s maximum exposure to credit risk
	is the carrying values of its financial assets and receivables, including derivatives with positive market values. These amounts
	are disclosed in Note 28.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta has policies and operating guidelines
	in place to ensure that financial instrument transactions are only entered into with high credit quality banks and financial institutions.
	These include limits in respect of counterparties to ensure that there are no significant concentrations of credit risk. Syngenta
	continuously monitors the creditworthiness of&nbsp;its counterparties based on credit ratings and credit default swap&nbsp;data.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	At December 31, 2016, Syngenta had no treasury
	or derivative transactions representing a significant concentration of credit risk. No&nbsp;credit losses have been incurred from
	investments in derivative financial instruments during the years ended December 31, 2016 and&nbsp;2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	To minimize its exposure to derivative positions,
	Syngenta enters into&nbsp;netting agreements under an International Swaps and Derivatives Association (ISDA) master agreement with
	its respective counterparties. In addition, for almost all derivative positions, Syngenta has entered into Credit Support Annex
	contracts (CSAs) under which&nbsp;cash is exchanged as collateral. The CSA contracts cumulatively limit either Syngenta&rsquo;s
	or the counterparty&rsquo;s aggregate credit risk exposure to no more than $1 million per counterparty on a weekly settlement basis
	for the positions for which CSA contracts have been agreed. There are no constraints on the cash exchanged and held between counterparties
	and the collateral can be used as part of operations. At&nbsp;December 31, 2016, an asset amounting to $349 million (2015: $267
	million), and a liability amounting to $9 million (2015: $43 million) were recorded representing cash paid and received by Syngenta
	as&nbsp;collateral under these CSAs.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The impact of credit risk on the fair value of
	derivatives is considered through market observable credit default swap spreads for Syngenta and its counterparties. The impact
	on the fair value of Syngenta&rsquo;s derivative positions at December 31, 2016 and 2015 of the risk of default by financial counterparties
	was not material.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The credit risk to operational assets is managed
	through the use of credit limits and is partially mitigated through commercial activities, which include barter operations, cash
	sales&nbsp;incentives and obtaining other security from customers where appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The following tables show the effect of set off
	rights that apply to financial assets and liabilities under the above ISDA and CSA agreements at December&nbsp;31, 2016 and 2015.
	Syngenta&rsquo;s rights under these arrangements would become enforceable in the event of a future default of the respective counterparty.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Liquidity risk and refinancing risk&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Within Syngenta&rsquo;s risk management framework,
	liquidity risk is defined as the risk of being unable to raise funds to meet payment obligations when they fall due.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Refinancing or funding risk is defined as the
	risk of being unable, on an ongoing basis, to borrow in the market to fund actual or proposed commitments. Syngenta mitigates its
	liquidity and refinancing risk by maintaining: a committed unsecured funding facility; ongoing discussions with its core banks
	to best monitor its funding capacity; simulations; and diversification of its debt portfolio.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta&rsquo;s liquidity risk policy is to
	maintain at all times sufficient liquidity reserves both at Group and subsidiary level in order to meet payment obligations as
	they become due and also to maintain an adequate liquidity margin. The planning and supervision of liquidity is&nbsp;the responsibility
	of the subsidiaries and Group Treasury. Liquidity&nbsp;requirements are forecasted on a weekly basis. Syngenta operates regional
	or country cash pools to allow efficient use of its liquidity reserves.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 55 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">

	55

<A NAME="eolPage217"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Short-term liquidity
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Two of Syngenta&rsquo;s largest markets are Europe,
	Africa and the Middle East and North America. Both sales and operating profit in these two regions are seasonal and are weighted
	towards the first half of the calendar year, reflecting the northern hemisphere planting and growing cycle. Latin America is another
	large market for Syngenta and sales and operating profit there are weighted towards the second half of the calendar year, reflecting
	the southern hemisphere planting and growing cycle. This seasonal operating activity results in seasonal working capital requirements.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Syngenta&rsquo;s principal source of liquidity
	consists of cash generated from&nbsp;operations. Working capital fluctuations due to the seasonality of&nbsp;the business are supported
	by short-term funding available from a&nbsp;$2.5 billion Global Commercial Paper program supported by a committed, revolving, multi-currency
	syndicated credit facility. In January 2016, the amount of this credit facility was increased from $1.5 billion to $2.5 billion.
	Its contractual expiry date is in 2019 but it has a change of control clause which allows each lender to cancel its commitment
	unless renegotiated terms are agreed within 30 days of a change of control occurring. In order to address the risk of early termination,
	ChemChina has provided cover for the backstop facility and also for other financing needs arising from the change of control via
	a committed Target Facilities Agreement that Syngenta expects to be able to access on successful completion of the ChemChina Tender
	Offer. The amount drawn under the Global Commercial Paper program at December 31, 2016 was $100 million (2015: $nil). The average
	outstanding balance under the Global Commercial Paper program for the year 2016 was $1,217 million (2015: $500 million).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The maturity analyses for Syngenta&rsquo;s current
	financial liabilities other than short-term derivative liabilities are presented in Notes 15 to 17.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The maturities of short term derivative liabilities
	are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 56%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	($m)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	Total
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%; BORDER-BOTTOM: #548235 1PT SOLID; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; COLOR: #404040; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	0&ndash;90
<BR>
	days
</TD>

<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Long-term financing&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Long-term capital employed is currently financed
	through eight unsecured bonds, one unsecured floating rate note, and unsecured notes issued under the Note Purchase Agreement in
	the US Private Placement market. During 2015, the 4.125 percent Eurobond 2015 with the principal of EUR 500 million matured.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	During 2015, Syngenta issued an unsecured non-current
	12 year EUR 500 million security with a fixed interest rate of 1.25 percent.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The following table shows Syngenta&rsquo;s contractually
	agreed (undiscounted) interest and principal repayments on long-term financing-related non-derivative financial liabilities and
	the related derivatives held at December 31, 2016 and 2015. Non-derivative financial liabilities are recorded at amortized cost
	(less related issuance costs) unless subject to fair value hedge accounting, in which case the liability is adjusted for the change
	in fair value of the hedged risk to the extent the hedge relationship is effective. Derivative financial liabilities are recorded
	at fair value. The table therefore shows the total carrying amount of Syngenta&rsquo;s financial debt adjusted for the effect,
	if any, of applying fair value hedge accounting.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Forecast data for liabilities that may be incurred
	in the future is not included in the table above. Amounts in foreign currency were translated to&nbsp;US dollars at the closing
	rate at the reporting date. Variable payments at each year end arising from financial instruments were calculated based on the
	forward interest rate yield curve and the spread that Syngenta pays on its outstanding debt and open derivatives at December 31,
	2016 and 2015, respectively. Non-derivative financial liabilities, repayment of which can be demanded by&nbsp;the counterparty
	at any time, have been assigned to&nbsp;the earliest repayment period.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Capital structure&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Absent major acquisitions, Syngenta targets maintaining
	a solid investment grade credit rating, as recognized by major third-party rating agencies, which it currently believes provides
	an optimal balance between financial flexibility and the cost of capital. Syngenta manages capital by monitoring levels of net
	debt, as calculated below, and equity against targets. Syngenta defines net debt as excluding financing-related derivatives and
	related collateral paid and received under CSA agreements as these balances offset reach other. Capital is returned to shareholders
	primarily through dividend payments, with the aim of continuous dividend growth, complemented by tactical share repurchases.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The net debt to equity ratio was 29 percent at
	December 31, 2016 (31 percent at December 31, 2015).
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The components of net debt at December 31, 2016
	and 2015 are as&nbsp;follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="COLOR: RGB(109,141,36); FONT: BOLD 12PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	28. Financial assets and liabilities
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #6D8D24; FONT: BOLD 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The following tables show the carrying amounts
	and fair values of financial assets and liabilities by category of financial instrument and reconciliation to where they are presented
	in the balance sheet at December 31, 2016 and 2015. The fair value hierarchy level is shown for those financial assets and liabilities
	that are carried at fair value in the balance sheet.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	The
	totals for equity investments at fair value through OCI include $75 million of level
	3 investments, mainly within Syngenta&rsquo;s venture business unit, presented in the
	level 2 column in the table above. The main valuation input for these investments is
	the price from their most recent shareholder financing transactions.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Carrying
	amount approximates the estimated fair value due to the short-term nature of the financial
	instruments
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	3
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Fair
	value is not required to be disclosed for non-financial assets and non-financial liabilities,
	including defined benefit pension assets
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	4
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Derivative
	financial assets and liabilities are measured at fair value through profit or loss except
	that gains and losses on cash flow hedges of forecast transactions are not recognized
	in profit or loss until the hedged transaction is recognized in profit or loss
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Fair
	values of these receivables are measured by discounting their cash flows at interest
	rates derived using observable yields on government bonds with maturities and currencies
	that match those of the respective receivable and the estimated credit risk of each receivable.
	The total fair value disclosed is due from counterparties that have not issued traded
	bonds and represents a level 3 fair value measurement
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	6
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Financial
	liabilities represent both exchange traded bonds and non-exchange traded private placement
	notes issued by Syngenta. The fair value disclosed consists of level 2 fair value measurements
	derived from observable price quotations for these bonds, except for one private placement
	note with a fair value of $144 million, which is a level 3 measurement because market
	interest rates and credit rates are not observable for the full period through to its
	maturity date in 2035
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	The
	totals for equity investments at fair value through OCI include $71 million of level
	3 investments, mainly within Syngenta&rsquo;s venture business unit, presented in the
	level 2 column in the table above. The main valuation input for these investments is
	the price from their most recent shareholder financing transactions.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Carrying
	amount approximates the estimated fair value due to the short-term nature of the financial
	instruments
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	3
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Fair
	value is not required to be disclosed for non-financial assets and non-financial liabilities,
	including defined benefit pension assets
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	4
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Derivative
	financial assets and liabilities are measured at fair value through profit or loss except
	that gains and losses on cash flow hedges of forecast transactions are not recognized
	in profit or loss until the hedged transaction is recognized in profit or loss
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Fair
	values of these receivables are measured by discounting their cash flows at interest
	rates derived using observable yields on government bonds with maturities and currencies
	that match those of the respective receivable and the estimated credit risk of each receivable.
	The total fair value disclosed is due from counterparties that have not issued traded
	bonds and represents a level 3 fair value measurement
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	6
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Financial
	liabilities represent both exchange traded bonds and non-exchange traded private placement
	notes issued by Syngenta. The fair value disclosed consists of level 2 fair value measurements
	derived from observable price quotations for these bonds, except for one private placement
	note with a fair value of $147 million, which is a level 3 measurement because market
	interest rates and credit rates are not observable for the full period through to its
	maturity date in 2035
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The levels of fair value hierarchy used above
	are defined as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Level 1 fair value measurements are those derived from
	quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Level 2 fair value measurements are those derived from
	inputs other than quoted prices included within level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, either directly (i.e.
	as prices) or indirectly (i.e. derived from prices); and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; COLOR: #404040; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	-
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Level 3 fair value measurements are those derived from
	valuation techniques that include inputs for the asset or liability that are not based on observable market data.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 21.25PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	The fair values of equity shareholdings subject
	to a lock-up period where the underlying shares are actively traded on a stock exchange is derived by applying a discount to the
	market price and are classified as level 2. They are reclassified as level 1 on expiry of the lock-up period. In 2016 and 2015,
	there were no transfers between level 1 and level 2 of the fair value hierarchy or between the fair value and amortized cost categories.
	In 2015, one equity shareholding was sold for $13 million in response to an offer from a third party to acquire all the equity
	of the company concerned. There were no transfers during the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014 into or out of&nbsp;level
	3 of the fair value hierarchy.
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 59 -->

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-

	59

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	-
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
	152
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: #DBDBDB 1PT SOLID; COLOR: #404040; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">

</TD>

	-

	(139)
</TD>
</TR>

</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

	1
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Includes
	immaterial amounts relating to financial assets classified as at fair value through profit
	or loss
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 3PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="COLOR: #404040; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 8.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	2
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="PADDING-RIGHT: 2PT; PADDING-LEFT: 2PT">
